title: Item Not Found - When Redeeming & Completing Bookings To The Till
text: Problem When inserting a booking reference in the Bookings screen on the till program, and the till prompt "Item not found!", this is due to the till is not aware of the PLU linked to the booking. This could be due to the item does not have a valid price for today's date (most common), PLU has been deleted, or the PLU has been restricted to not be available for the till's department. Solution Retrieve a booking reference example, and open this up on the Back Office and till program, when the other PLU's are added to the till's basket, the PLU in question will be missing. Find this PLU in the Back Office; you can do this by selecting the resource in the righthand grey box ((1) in screenshot below). The resource selector box will appear at the bottom of the screen, showing whether it has a valid price for the date of the booking, and the PLU code ((2) in screenshot below) that you can search within Price Lookup Index to amend the PLU. Don't forget to recreate till data and update the tills.
description:
Problem 

When inserting a booking reference in the Bookings screen on the till program, and the till prompt "Item not found!", this is due to the till is not aware of the PLU linked to the booking. This could be due to the item does not have a valid price for today's date (most common), PLU has been deleted, or the PLU has been restricted to not be available for the till's department.

 

  

 


Solution 

Retrieve a booking reference example, and open this up on the Back Office and till program, when the other PLU's are added to the till's basket, the PLU in question will be missing. Find this PLU in the Back Office; you can do this by selecting the resource in the righthand grey box ((1) in screenshot below). 

  

The resource selector box will appear at the bottom of the screen, showing whether it has a valid price for the date of the booking, and the PLU code ((2) in screenshot below) that you can search within Price Lookup Index to amend the PLU. Don't forget to recreate till data and update the tills.

title: CRITICAL ERROR - Referential integrity check (no employees found) When Trying To Launch Till Program
text: When trying to launch the till program and the program errors with the below error, recreate till data so that the tills dat file C:\ProgramData\Merac\MeracDat.txt gets rebuilt, as this error is referring to having no employee data within here, which usually also means there is no data at all.
description: When trying to launch the till program and the program errors with the below error, recreate till data so that the tills dat file C:\ProgramData\Merac\MeracDat.txt gets rebuilt, as this error is referring to having no employee data within here, which usually also means there is no data at all.

title: CRITICAL ERROR – Unable to load POS – Picture on button
text: If like in this case the error is with the Panel Button Info table check the C:\ProgramData\Graphics folder for the linked picture. You should be able to open the picture without issue. If like in this case the picture is corrupt the till will fail to load till data: Delete all the pictures in the C:\ProgramData\Graphics folder that look to be corrupt (Windows cannot display the image): Restart MeracUpdater and the system will pull the pictures down from the database. If they however are corrupt database side (Like in this instance, the pictures still will not be usable) Find a till the POS is working on and re-create till data from there, the pictures should then get overwritten with working versions. If this is not possible, the team will need to re-upload the pictures to the buttons. A temporary solution to allow the POS to load is to remove the line from the DAT file, that way it will not load the picture and the POS will open however the button will not display the image. Original email trail from Castle Howard: >
description:
If like in this case the error is with the Panel Button Info table check the C:\ProgramData\Graphics folder for the linked picture.  

  

You should be able to open the picture without issue. If like in this case the picture is corrupt the till will fail to load till data: 

  

 

  


Delete all the pictures in the C:\ProgramData\Graphics folder that look to be corrupt (Windows cannot display the image): 

  

 


  

Restart MeracUpdater and the system will pull the pictures down from the database.  

If they however are corrupt database side (Like in this instance, the pictures still will not be usable) 

  

Find a till the POS is working on and re-create till data from there, the pictures should then get overwritten with working versions.  

  

If this is not possible, the team will need to re-upload the pictures to the buttons.  

  

A temporary solution to allow the POS to load is to remove the line from the DAT file, that way it will not load the picture and the POS will open however the button will not display the image.  


  

 

  

Original email trail from Castle Howard: 

  

<<RE HD-106958 - Unable to load POS issue with pictures on buttons.msg>>

title: Disable Edge Swipe
text: Disable edge swipe on win 10 tills and tablets: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) Computer Configuration/Administrative Templates/Windows Components/Edge UI In the right pane of Edge UI in Local Group Policy Editor, double click/tap on the Allow edge swipe policy to edit it. Set as disabled. Apply and Ok. Change will be applied immediately.

title: Issues When Launching Receipt Designer
text: If the Back Office program looks as though it freezes/crashed when launching the Receipt Designer. Browse to C:\ProgramFiles(x86)\Merac and search for VisualBasicPowerPacksSetup.exe Run the setup and follow the instructions on screen. Double check that ReceiptDesigner.exe is visible, both located in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac. Customers IT may need to perform this if this requires a Windows Administrator. .Net Framework 3.5 is also required for this program to run. But Windows would usual prompt to install this if this is the case. In this instance you will get an error as below (ReceiptDesign.exe would be shown). .NET can be installed easily from Programs and Features. The easiest way is to enable .Net 3.5 from Windows Features: I believe this will require a restart of the PC to install. Receipt designer will now work (Any problems please contact a member of the support team)

title: Inherit Booking Type From Booking Template For Internet Bookings
text: If a customer would like to have all future Internet bookings inherit the booking type that is set on its respective booking template, rather than the booking type set to Internet, then you will need to run the below SQL: BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE Options SET optValue=1 WHERE optCode='BKGTYPTMPL' AND optBranch=1 --COMMIT If the customer would also like us to retrospectively change previous Internet bookings booking type to what is currently set for the booking templates they were booked from, then you can run the below SQL, specifying the booking template(s) they want to be changed on the rare occasion they would like this. SELECT * INTO BAKBKGHeader29MAR23 FROM BKGHeader BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE a SET a.bkhType=b.bthBookingType FROM BKGHeader a JOIN BKGTemplateHdr b ON a.bkhTemplateID=b.bthTemplateId WHERE bkhIsInternet=1 --AND bkhTemplateID IN ('') --COMMIT
description:
If a customer would like to have all future Internet bookings inherit the booking type that is set on its respective booking template, rather than the booking type set to Internet, then you will need to run the below SQL:

 

BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE Options

SET optValue=1

WHERE optCode='BKGTYPTMPL' AND optBranch=1

--COMMIT 

 

If the customer would also like us to retrospectively change previous Internet bookings booking type to what is currently set for the booking templates they were booked from, then you can run the below SQL, specifying the booking template(s) they want to be changed on the rare occasion they would like this.

 

SELECT * INTO BAKBKGHeader29MAR23 FROM BKGHeader

 

BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE a

SET a.bkhType=b.bthBookingType

FROM BKGHeader a

JOIN BKGTemplateHdr b ON a.bkhTemplateID=b.bthTemplateId

WHERE bkhIsInternet=1 --AND bkhTemplateID IN ('')

--COMMIT

title: Tesco Vouchers/MeracProxy Error
text: Error message on the till when trying to use a Tesco voucher. Remote onto the server and go to the services. Look for MeracProxyService. Restart the service and try using the voucher again. If this does not work, check to see whether the server's IP address has changed. You can check what the IP address is set as for the Tesco's vouchers in the voucher Scheme in the MStore Backoffice software. If these are different update the Proxy Sever IP to the new one and recreate till data. Make sure to tell the site to logout of the POS and update the tills.
description:
Error message on the till when trying to use a Tesco voucher.

 

 

Remote onto the server and go to the services. Look for MeracProxyService.

 

 

Restart the service and try using the voucher again. 

 

If this does not work, check to see whether the server's IP address has changed. 

You can check what the IP address is set as for the Tesco's vouchers in the voucher Scheme in the MStore Backoffice software.

 

 

If these are different update the Proxy Sever IP to the new one and recreate till data. Make sure to tell the site to logout of the POS and update the tills.

title: "Unexpected Error" When Opening Back Office On Windows 7 PC
text: Issue When launching the Back Office on a PC running Windows 7, you get a "Unexpected error" MStore error. The majority of the time, this will be tills we would have supplied when Windows 7 was the only operating system available, as these machines had their Windows Updates disabled to prevent the tills being out of action to do updates at time. Fix Make sure the Windows Update service is set to automatic, and start this. Check for updates, it'll prompt with "Windows could not search for new updates windows 7. Error code: 80072EFE". Restart PC, and then run Windows Update Loop Fix program (https://axk3btg-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/harry_willatts_k3btg_com/Ep5wRRfNB5VKi2ZEefJzMqsBOfslT7QVy4mWE1t1a5ARoQ?e=OjZGhp - Any issues accessing this, speak to Harry Willatts), following all the step it states. It will restart twice, while downloading and installing the updates. Then check for Windows Updates again. This will then sit on 'Checking for updates…' for a while until all relevant updates are found, and will then prompt to 'Install updates'. You can leave these updates installing. The Back Office will be able to be opened as usual.
description:
Issue

When launching the Back Office on a PC running Windows 7, you get a "Unexpected error" MStore error.

 

 

The majority of the time, this will be tills we would have supplied when Windows 7 was the only operating system available, as these machines had their Windows Updates disabled to prevent the tills being out of action to do updates at time.

 

Fix

Make sure the Windows Update service is set to automatic, and start this. Check for updates, it'll prompt with "Windows could not search for new updates windows 7. Error code: 80072EFE".

 

Restart PC, and then run Windows Update Loop Fix program (https://axk3btg-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/harry_willatts_k3btg_com/Ep5wRRfNB5VKi2ZEefJzMqsBOfslT7QVy4mWE1t1a5ARoQ?e=OjZGhp - Any issues accessing this, speak to Harry Willatts), following all the step it states.

 

It will restart twice, while downloading and installing the updates. Then check for Windows Updates again. This will then sit on 'Checking for updates…' for a while until all relevant updates are found, and will then prompt to 'Install updates'.

 

You can leave these updates installing. The Back Office will be able to be opened as usual.

title: Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint 'PK_PrintLayoutHeader' When Creating New Document Design
text: Problem When cloning or creating a new document design in Receipt Designer, and the below message appears, this means the PrintLayoutHeader field in RecordIDs. For some reason, they have document designs with ID's higher than what is stated in RecordIDs. Fix Within SQL you can see the problem by running the top two SELECT queries: SELECT * FROM RecordIDs WHERE ridTableName='PrintLayoutHeader' AND ridBranch=1 SELECT * FROM PrintLayoutHeader ORDER BY plhid DESC When you are ready to fix the issue, you can run the below statement: BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE RecordIDs SET ridRecNum=(SELECT MAX(plhid) FROM PrintLayoutHeader)+1 WHERE ridTableName='PrintLayoutHeader' AND ridBranch=1 --COMMIT
description:
Problem

When cloning or creating a new document design in Receipt Designer, and the below message appears, this means the PrintLayoutHeader field in RecordIDs. For some reason, they have document designs with ID's higher than what is stated in RecordIDs.

 

 

 

Fix

Within SQL you can see the problem by running the top two SELECT queries:

 

SELECT * FROM RecordIDs

WHERE ridTableName='PrintLayoutHeader' AND ridBranch=1

 

SELECT * FROM PrintLayoutHeader

ORDER BY plhid DESC

 

When you are ready to fix the issue, you can run the below statement:

 

BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE RecordIDs

SET ridRecNum=(SELECT MAX(plhid) FROM PrintLayoutHeader)+1

WHERE ridTableName='PrintLayoutHeader' AND ridBranch=1

--COMMIT

title: Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint 'PK_DepSummary' When Inserting Value In Per Cap Department
text: Problem When trying to insert a value in the Per Cap Dpt for a specific sub-department, it throws the below error. This is likely to be because they have moved sub-department to another parent department, where the data already in the DepSummary table that is linked to this sub-department, has a different parent department. Fix We need to update the parent department record number for all the records that is linked to the sub-department with this issue. SELECT * FROM Departments --depRecNo = 20 (Farm Shop) - Affected sub-department --depParentDept = 3 (Retail) - Parent department of affected sub-department SELECT * FROM DepSummary WHERE dsuSubDpt=20 SELECT * FROM Departments WHERE depRecNo=18 --Parent department of the affected sub-department stated in DepSummary isn't showing in Departments, meaning has since been deleted. SELECT * INTO BAKDepSummary29Mar2023 FROM DepSummary BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE DepSummary SET dsuDpt=3 WHERE dsuSubDpt=20 AND dsuDpt=18 --COMMIT
description:
Problem

When trying to insert a value in the Per Cap Dpt for a specific sub-department, it throws the below error. This is likely to be because they have moved sub-department to another parent department, where the data already in the DepSummary table that is linked to this sub-department, has a different parent department.

 

 

Fix

We need to update the parent department record number for all the records that is linked to the sub-department with this issue.

 

SELECT * FROM Departments

 

--depRecNo = 20 (Farm Shop) - Affected sub-department

--depParentDept = 3 (Retail) - Parent department of affected sub-department

 

SELECT * FROM DepSummary

WHERE dsuSubDpt=20

 

SELECT * FROM Departments

WHERE depRecNo=18 --Parent department of the affected sub-department stated in DepSummary isn't showing in Departments, meaning has since been deleted.

 

SELECT * INTO BAKDepSummary29Mar2023 FROM DepSummary

 

BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE DepSummary

SET dsuDpt=3

WHERE dsuSubDpt=20 AND dsuDpt=18

--COMMIT

title: Direct Debit Submission - Incorrect Syntax near 'XXXX'
text: If you get Incorrect syntax near 'XXXX' it is generally because the customer account contains an apostrophe To fix: Log into the database and find the account (4th field is the account record number (168164)) Update the name to no longer contain an apostrophe SQL below: (Ensure it ONLY updates the 1 record you want to update, always use a begin transaction and commit after you have checked) Select * from Customer Where cusSurname like 'O%DoWD%' and cusAccRecNo = 168164 Select * from Account Where accRecNo = 168164 begin transaction update Account Set accName = 'Wendy O Dowd' Where accRecNo = 168164 commit begin transaction update Customer Set cusSurname = 'O Dowd' Where cusAccRecNo = 168164 commit
description:
If you get Incorrect syntax near 'XXXX' it is generally because the customer account contains an apostrophe

 

 

 

To fix:

 

Log into the database and find the account (4th field is the account record number (168164))

 

 

Update the name to no longer contain an apostrophe

 

 

 

SQL below:

 

(Ensure it ONLY updates the 1 record you want to update, always use a begin transaction and commit after you have checked)

 

Select * from Customer 

Where cusSurname like   'O%DoWD%'

and cusAccRecNo = 168164

 

Select * from Account 

Where accRecNo = 168164

 

begin transaction

update Account 

Set accName = 'Wendy O Dowd'

Where accRecNo = 168164

commit

 

begin transaction

update Customer 

Set cusSurname = 'O Dowd'

Where cusAccRecNo = 168164

commit

title: Scanning member card - Item not found
text: When scanning a membership card get 'Item Not Found' Example below: Check the membership type the card is linked to. In this instance 'Individual Membership' Normally this error means the system cannot find a valid PLU / Price. Having a look at the membership setup, can see there is no price defined for the entry fee: The system is expecting a price to be defined for when the member card is scanned. Have set it back to a zero price: Re-create till data. Update the till. Will now scan correctly.

title: Move booking error
text: When this error shows up when attempting to move a booking from one date to another, nine times out of ten it is to do with the calendar periods connected to the PLU's in the booking. First step is to look up the PLU's and which calendar group they are connected to. If that calendar group is out of date or the dates you are trying to move the booking too is not available you will get the above error. Updating and making the dates will make the booking possible to move then.
description:
When this error shows up when attempting to move a booking from one date to another, nine times out of ten it is to do with the calendar periods connected to the PLU's in the booking. 

 

First step is to look up the PLU's and which calendar group they are connected to. 

If that calendar group is out of date or the dates you are trying to move the booking too is not available you will get the above error. 

 

Updating and making the dates will make the booking possible to move then.

title: Unable to scan member cards
text: When using the POS, scanning the member card results in the customer details flashing up and vanishing instantly without any error being shown on screen. Solution: This is caused by having an affiliate scheme set in system options: The system will default to trying to contact an external scheme and will not be looking at the internal memberships. It doesn't give an error, it will just flash up and clear the info box. Nothing will be put into the basket. Remove any entry in the 'Use external affiliates scheme' UNLESS the customer DOES use an affiliates scheme RHS WILL be using it, but is currently not active (as of 11 Aug 23) I believe Marwell use it and EH (E-forms).

title: Cannot insert the value NULL into column 'balAmountToIncome' When Running Auto-Complete Booking Process
text: Example of error Solution The system is referring to the price of the PLU on booking 166418 does not have a valid price for the booked date or booking date. Therefore, you will need to add a valid price for these dates, 4th April 2023 & 19th August 2023. I saw that the main PLU is a PLU Group Item, so you will need to add a price for the PLU CHARTERGWSFOOD & CHARTERGWSMASTER. To add a price to the master PLU, you will need to temporarily untick PLU Group Item?, then View/Add Price, add a valid price in, and then re-tick the PLU Group Item? option and Save.
description:
Example of error


Solution

The system is referring to the price of the PLU on booking 166418 does not have a valid price for the booked date or booking date. Therefore, you will need to add a valid price for these dates, 4th April 2023 & 19th August 2023. I saw that the main PLU is a PLU Group Item, so you will need to add a price for the PLU CHARTERGWSFOOD & CHARTERGWSMASTER.

To add a price to the master PLU, you will need to temporarily untick PLU Group Item?, then View/Add Price, add a valid price in, and then re-tick the PLU Group Item? option and Save.

title: 'Could not make a connection to the database' When Trying To Log Into The Back Office
text: This can be caused if the server line in C:\ProgramData\Merac\MStore.ini is pointing at a server name, and not an IP address, and the PC does not have the DNS server setup to tell the PC what the local IP address is for the server. This would be a network/IT issue that would have to make sure the DNS server is setup correct, and PC's are pointing at it. As a workaround, you can manually set the local IP address for a PC name within C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts.
description:
This can be caused if the server line in C:\ProgramData\Merac\MStore.ini is pointing at a server name, and not an IP address, and the PC does not have the DNS server setup to tell the PC what the local IP address is for the server. This would be a network/IT issue that would have to make sure the DNS server is setup correct, and PC's are pointing at it.


As a workaround, you can manually set the local IP address for a PC name within C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts.

title: ‘Must close or hide topmost modal form first’ Error on POS
text: Error ‘Must close or hide topmost modal form first’ appearing on the POS. Resolution This is caused by setting the Change Due Screen Time Out to above 0, as well as specifying a cash drawer driver. This is due to the cash drawer closes the Change Due screen, and then the time out will try to do the same when the specified time is hit, but shows this error trying to do this. Removing one or the other option can resolve this.
description:
Error
‘Must close or hide topmost modal form first’ appearing on the POS.


Resolution

This is caused by setting the Change Due Screen Time Out  to above 0, as well as specifying a cash drawer driver. This is due to the cash drawer closes the Change Due screen, and then the time out will try to do the same when the specified time is hit, but shows this error trying to do this.
 

Removing one or the other option can resolve this.

title: 'Element not found' Program Error When Launching Promotions Screen
text: Error When launching the Promotions screen, and you receive the below error regarding 'Element not found'. Resolution This is caused by a sub-departments parent department has been assigned to another parent department, where you can only have two level of departments. Or if the parent department has been deleted. You can run the below SQL to find the affected department that has an issue with its parent department: SELECT a.depRecNo [Sub-dep Rec No], a.depCode [Sub-dep Code], a.depName [Sub-dep Name], b.depRecNo [Parent Dep Rec No], b.depCode [Parent Dep Code], b.depName [Parent Dep Name], b.depParentDept [Parent Deps Parent Dep], c.depName [Parent Deps Parent Dep Name] FROM Departments a LEFT JOIN Departments b ON a.depParentDept=b.depRecNo LEFT JOIN Departments c ON b.depParentDept=c.depRecNo WHERE b.depRecNo<>b.depParentDept To fix this, you will need to make resurrect the parent department. In this particular example, the parent department had its linked parent department of 9, which should be its own depRecNo of 26. The error now no longer exists. SELECT * INTO BAKDepartments14Oct2023 FROM Departments BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE Departments SET depParentDept=26 WHERE depRecNo=26 AND depParentDept=9 --COMMIT I am going to report this behaviour to development, in hope to prevent this from being allowed to occur in future. Linked ticket #32591.
description:
Error

When launching the Promotions screen, and you receive the below error regarding 'Element not found'.



Resolution

This is caused by a sub-departments parent department has been assigned to another parent department, where you can only have two level of departments. Or if the parent department has been deleted.


You can run the below SQL to find the affected department that has an issue with its parent department:

SELECT a.depRecNo [Sub-dep Rec No], a.depCode [Sub-dep Code], a.depName [Sub-dep Name], b.depRecNo [Parent Dep Rec No], b.depCode [Parent Dep Code], b.depName [Parent Dep Name], b.depParentDept [Parent Deps Parent Dep], c.depName [Parent Deps Parent Dep Name] FROM Departments a
LEFT JOIN Departments b ON a.depParentDept=b.depRecNo
LEFT JOIN Departments c ON b.depParentDept=c.depRecNo
WHERE b.depRecNo<>b.depParentDept

To fix this, you will need to make resurrect the parent department. In this particular example, the parent department had its linked parent department of 9, which should be its own depRecNo of 26. The error now no longer exists.


SELECT * INTO BAKDepartments14Oct2023 FROM Departments

BEGIN TRANSACTION 
UPDATE Departments
SET depParentDept=26
WHERE depRecNo=26 AND depParentDept=9
--COMMIT

I am going to report this behaviour to development, in hope to prevent this from being allowed to occur in future. Linked ticket #32591.

title: Cannot Connect To Shared Printer
text: If you cannot connect a PC to a shared printer on another PC, then attempt to add this setting into the registry. Go to: Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Print. Add a DWORD (32-bit) Value, called RpcAuthnLevelPrivacyEnabled. Modify this setting, to make sure the Value data is 0 and base is set to Hexadecimal.
description:
If you cannot connect a PC to a shared printer on another PC, then attempt to add this setting into the registry.


Go to: Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Print.


Add a DWORD (32-bit) Value, called RpcAuthnLevelPrivacyEnabled. Modify this setting, to make sure the Value data is 0 and base is set to Hexadecimal.

title: PAY-Failed to save Payment record for Txn No xxxx
text: If you get the below error: (Full error message from TillTxns) PAY-Failed to save Payment record for Txn No 187644 on Till 1 (Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint PK_Payments . Cannot insert duplicate key in object dbo.Payments . The duplicate key value is (1, 609249, 0). The statement has been terminated.) Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint PK_TXNDetail . Cannot insert duplicate key in object dbo.TXNDetail . The duplicate key value is (1, 609249, 1). MC_InsertTxnDetail line: 311 This generally means the system has already processed the record and is trying to process it again. Solution: Check the transaction header table to see if the transaction has already been processed: Select * from TXNHeader Where txhTillTXNo = 187644 and txhTillNo = 1 If it already exists, check the last transaction number processed for that till, as i've seen instances where multiple transactions have been processed and then the system gets out of sync. Select top 10 * from TXNHeader Where txhTillNo = 1 ORder by txhNo desc In this case it was the last transaction processed: Delete the transaction from TillTxns as it already exists. Back up the table: Select * into BAKTillTxns23Oct23 from TillTXNs Commit the change and the backlog should now process. If there are multiple transactions, you need to remove all that have already processed.
description:
If you get the below error:



(Full error message from TillTxns)


PAY-Failed to save Payment record for Txn No 187644 on Till 1 (Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint  PK_Payments . Cannot insert duplicate key in object  dbo.Payments . The duplicate key value is (1, 609249, 0).  The statement has been terminated.) Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint  PK_TXNDetail . Cannot insert duplicate key in object  dbo.TXNDetail . The duplicate key value is (1, 609249, 1). MC_InsertTxnDetail  line: 311


This generally means the system has already processed the record and is trying to process it again. 


Solution:


Check the transaction header table to see if the transaction has already been processed:


Select * from TXNHeader 

Where txhTillTXNo = 187644

and txhTillNo = 1



If it already exists, check the last transaction number processed for that till, as i've seen instances where multiple transactions have been processed and then the system gets out of sync. 



Select top 10 * from TXNHeader 

Where txhTillNo = 1

ORder by txhNo desc


In this case it was the last transaction processed:



Delete the transaction from TillTxns as it already exists. 


Back up the table:


Select * into BAKTillTxns23Oct23

from TillTXNs 



Commit the change and the backlog should now process. 


If there are multiple transactions, you need to remove all that have already processed.

title: Black box where the keyboard or number pad should be
text: If a customer calls in and states that the screen layout is showing a large black box, this will be because the screen layout has no had the keyboard or number pad configured. Each new screen layout will require this setting up. Its to allow custom buttons where required. Example: Solution: Cntrl + Right click on the box, this will then bring up the button panel configuration: This will then ask you to select the panel you want to copy. In this case I want the Full Qwerty Large (The most common ones are this Querty Large and Numeric Pad Large) The system will then prompt to ask if you want to make a copy of the buttons or reference the existing one. Generally I select Yes to make a unique one, that way any changes made on this panel won't affect others. You can customise the panel at this point, if required. In most cases just click Ok to apply the change. Ensure you now re-create till data (from the till you are connected to) after making the change, otherwise next time the till is opened the same issue will occur.

title: Stock Take Not Showing As Stock Take After Uploading From Stock Take Scanner
text: Uploading a stock take from a Stock Take Scanner, and the stock take does not show as a stock take in the Stock Receipt/Take screen. This is due to a bug which sets the stock take's sthFromLocation and sthMoveType to 0 in StockTakeHdr. To fix this, you can insert the correct sthRecNo in [Stock Take Rec No] in the below SQL, and run this. This will then correctly show as a stock take, that the customer can continue to process and complete. The main stock location is 34. But if the stock take is for another location, you will need to update to the lkuRecNo of the stock location in question. BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE StockTakeHdr SET sthFromLocation=34, sthMoveType=3 WHERE sthRecNo=[Stock Take Rec No] --COMMIT
description:
Uploading a stock take from a Stock Take Scanner, and the stock take does not show as a stock take in the Stock Receipt/Take screen. This is due to a bug which sets the stock take's sthFromLocation and sthMoveType to 0 in StockTakeHdr.


To fix this, you can insert the correct sthRecNo in [Stock Take Rec No] in the below SQL, and run this. This will then correctly show as a stock take, that the customer can continue to process and complete. The main stock location is 34. But if the stock take is for another location, you will need to update to the lkuRecNo of the stock location in question.


BEGIN TRANSACTION 
UPDATE StockTakeHdr
SET sthFromLocation=34, sthMoveType=3
WHERE sthRecNo=[Stock Take Rec No]
--COMMIT

title: RHS - Database Sync
text: All RHS members are created in an external system called CARE Care members are imported into the MStoreVS database: There is imported via the MeracCareService There is an RHSMemberSYNCD table which shows all members that have been sent in. SQL below that allows you to check what has been imported: SELECT rmmCardNum,rmmForeNames +' '+ rmmSurname, rmmPostCode,rmmDateJoined, rmmDateRenewed, rmmDateExpires,rmmDateChanged FROM [MeracStoreVS].[dbo].RHSMemberSYNCD WHERE rmmCardNum IN (SELECT CardNumbers FROM @CardNumbers) ORDER BY rmmDateChanged DESC This also contains errors and can be used for troubleshooting. Normally its down to members not being sent in. [MeracStoreVS].[dbo].Address ON cusAccRecNo = addAccRecNo AND cusSeq = addSeq WHERE cusCardNum IN (SELECT CardNumbers FROM @CardNumbers) UNION ALL --Wisley SELECT 'MeracStoreWS' AS prvAccRecNo AND cusSeq = prvCusSeq JOIN [RHS-WelcomeSQL].[MeracStoreWS].[dbo].Address ON cusAccRecNo = addAccRecNo AND cusSeq = addSeq WHERE cusCardNum IN (SELECT CardNumbers FROM @CardNumbers) UNION JOIN [MeracStoreHH].[dbo].Address ON cusAccRecNo = addAccRecNo AND cusSeq = addSeq WHERE cusCardNum IN (SELECT CardNumbers FROM @CardNumbers) UNION ALL --Rosemoor SELECT 'MeracStoreRM' AS title: SAGE / DREAM - Data Export - Things to check
text: If any issues arise regarding the Sage / Dream (Longleat) export, the exported information can be found in the Nominal Posting Header and Detail tables: Header contains the batch number, from and to date, date posted, who posted it and a description for the file created. Detail contains the totals per nominal code that have been exported per batch: Taking the 7th Jan 24 as an example: The TANC (Transaction Analysis by Nominal Code) report should match exactly with the export. To check what data is included within each batch: There is a field in the Transaction Header table called txhNphRecNo which is a record of which batch the transaction was exported within: Linking transaction header to transaction detail will show exactly what is in each batch: If anything has been missed by the export, the txhNphRecNo will be NULL Not all data will be exported! This is down to what site chose to export. Anything without a Nominal Code set will be ignored.
description:
If any issues arise regarding the Sage / Dream (Longleat) export, the exported information can be found in the Nominal Posting Header and Detail tables:



Header contains the batch number, from and to date, date posted, who posted it and a description for the file created. 



Detail contains the totals per nominal code that have been exported per batch:



Taking the 7th Jan 24 as an example:




The TANC (Transaction Analysis by Nominal Code) report should match exactly with the export. 



To check what data is included within each batch:


There is a field in the Transaction Header table called txhNphRecNo which is a record of which batch the transaction was exported within:



Linking transaction header to transaction detail will show exactly what is in each batch:



If anything has been missed by the export, the txhNphRecNo will be NULL



Not all data will be exported! This is down to what site chose to export. Anything without a Nominal Code set will be ignored.

title: Layaways Stuck
text: Occasionally sites call in when layaways have got stuck open Layaways are stored in the TXNLayHeader and TXNLayDetail tables. These are active tables, meaning they update in real time and no long term data is stored within them. Header will show the table number / name and if the table is locked to a specific till If the lock has got stuck (happens occasionally) it will mean site cannot open it on any of their tills. Clear the lahLockTillNo and site will be able to re-open it. TXNLayDetail shows the details of what is in each layaway: Occasionally the layway won't clear at all, in which case back up both tables. (If you aren't sure how to: https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/103000274068?lang=en) Each layaway will have a unique LayNo. ONLY remove the one that is an issue. Ensure that you clear both tables and also check TXNLaySubHeader. This isn't always populated, I believe this is only used in specific scenarios but best to check.
description:
Occasionally sites call in when layaways have got stuck open 


Layaways are stored in the TXNLayHeader and TXNLayDetail tables. 

These are active tables, meaning they update in real time and no long term data is stored within them. 


Header will show the table number / name and if the table is locked to a specific till 

If the lock has got stuck (happens occasionally) it will mean site cannot open it on any of their tills. 



Clear the lahLockTillNo and site will be able to re-open it. 


TXNLayDetail shows the details of what is in each layaway:



Occasionally the layway won't clear at all, in which case back up both tables. (If you aren't sure how to: https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/103000274068?lang=en)


Each layaway will have a unique LayNo. ONLY remove the one that is an issue. 


Ensure that you clear both tables and also check TXNLaySubHeader. This isn't always populated, I believe this is only used in specific scenarios but best to check.

title: Return Visit Search Not Displaying Correctly
text: When using the Return Visit Search, and it displays as below, the format file needs to be applied to the site. Run the attached SQL statements on customer's databases. FRETURNVISITSEARCH (STDXVGA).txt for standard till layouts, and FRETURNVISITSEARCH (STDXVGA-TIMELINES).txt for standard timelines layout. Make sure you specify the MStore database within the statement. When you have done this, log into a corresponding till layout, run set the command on a button to test the functionality out. A black box will appear at the bottom of the window. Right-click on this and set the button panel to Full Qwerty Large. It will then show as below: After this, recreate till data to make these changes live to send out to the tills when they next update. If you had this issue, you may also have the same issue with the Return Visit Edit screen, which can be fixed via this Knowledge Base article: Return Visit Edit Screen Not Displaying Correctly.
description:

When you have done this, log into a corresponding till layout, run set the command on a button to test the functionality out. A black box will appear at the bottom of the window. Right-click on this and set the button panel to Full Qwerty Large.



It will then show as below:



After this, recreate till data to make these changes live to send out to the tills when they next update. title: Membership Wizard Not Launching When Pressed
text: If you press the Membership Wizard button within the Back Office or in the till program, and it either throws an error message or nothing happens. You will need the latest PAddress.dll & PErrTrap.dll files in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac on the PC in question. These files would usually be pushed out as part of an upgrade, and so make second line support aware of this, in case this will need to be performed site wide. If this is for a personal PC, the latest files (as of 13th February 2024) are attached, that you can add in yourself.

title: Setting up Batch Emailer with Gmail
text: If you get the below error: 2 factor authentication needs to be enabled within Gmail: Once enabled and set up, go back into the 2-step verification and select 'App Passwords' Create a new entry for batch emailer: This will create a fixed password (that it appears to not show again so make note of it) Enter the fixed password into the batch emailer config: Send yourself a test to ensure this is now working without error.

title: Booking Letter not sending
text: Users can sometimes get this error when trying to send a booking letter from the back office. This issue tends to happen if the user has had a new machine and the permissions or wrong version of Word has been installed. The main causes of the issue are Checking Word version for 32 bit Open Word and head to 'File' - 'Account' -'About Word' Confirm the current version of Word running on the machine. If it is 64bit then the 32bit version will need to be installed as MStore only works with the 32bit version. Permissions on MStore folders Grant Full Permissions over the following folders for all users: C:\ProgramData\Merac\ C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\ (C:\Program Files\Merac if 32bit) Right click on the folder Click Properties Select the Security Tab Add Everyone Tick Full Control Change mapped drive to Hostname The below screenshot displays a customer using a mapped network drive to access the booking letter documents. Prior to the screenshot the mapped drive was pointing and setup to the IP of the customers server instead of the hostname. Using IP didn't seem to grant full permissions to the booking documents which caused and issue with opening the word document and MStore making the changes needed to add the customer details to the template. Changing this drive to use the server's hostname granted full permissions and edit access to the booking documents.
description:
Users can sometimes get this error when trying to send a booking letter from the back office. This issue tends to happen if the user has had a new machine and the permissions or wrong version of Word has been installed.




The main causes of the issue are




Checking Word version for 32 bit


Open Word and head to 

'File' - 'Account' -'About Word'

Confirm the current version of Word running on the machine. If it is 64bit then the 32bit version will need to be installed as MStore only works with the 32bit version.


Permissions on MStore folders


Grant Full Permissions over the following folders for all users:
C:\ProgramData\Merac\
 C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\ (C:\Program Files\Merac if 32bit)
 
  1. Right click on the folder
  2. Click Properties
  3. Select the Security Tab
  4. Add Everyone
  5. Tick Full Control


Change mapped drive to Hostname


The below screenshot displays a customer using a mapped network drive to access the booking letter documents. Prior to the screenshot the mapped drive was pointing and setup to the IP of the customers server instead of the hostname. Using IP didn't seem to grant full permissions to the booking documents which caused and issue with opening the word document and MStore making the changes needed to add the customer details to the template. Changing this drive to use the server's hostname granted full permissions and edit access to the booking documents.

title: Overflow error when opening booking wizard / event wizard
text: If you open booking wizard and some of the sessions just crash and show run-time error 6 - Overflow or the event wizard just shows overflow: Check the lookups table to ensure that the record number hasn't jumped up into the thousands! If so, this needs to be corrected as the system isn't expecting such a high number. Back up the below tables first. SQL script from when this happened at RHS. Modify as required: --Update Lookups to reduce the record number update Lookups Set lkuRecNo =501Where lkurecno = 100001 update Lookups Set lkuRecNo =502Where lkurecno = 100002 --Set session header values to match the new lookup values update SessionHdr set shdSessionType =501where shdSessionType =100001 update SessionHdr set shdSessionType =502where shdSessionType =100002 --Update PriceLookups to re-link the new session type update pricelookups set plusessiontype = 501where plusessiontype = 100001 update pricelookups set plusessiontype = 502where plusessiontype = 100002 --Set RecordIds to match the last lookup value update RecordIDs Set ridRecNum = 530 Where ridTableName = 'Lookups'
description:
If you open booking wizard and some of the sessions just crash and show run-time error 6 - Overflow or the event wizard just shows overflow:




Check the lookups table to ensure that the record number hasn't jumped up into the thousands! 



If so, this needs to be corrected as the system isn't expecting such a high number.


Back up the below tables first.


SQL script from when this happened at RHS. Modify as required:


--Update Lookups to reduce the record number

update Lookups Set lkuRecNo =501Where lkurecno = 100001

update Lookups Set lkuRecNo =502Where lkurecno = 100002


--Set session header values to match the new lookup values

update SessionHdr set shdSessionType =501where shdSessionType =100001

update SessionHdr set shdSessionType =502where shdSessionType =100002 


--Update PriceLookups to re-link the new session type

update pricelookups set plusessiontype = 501where plusessiontype = 100001

update pricelookups set plusessiontype = 502where plusessiontype = 100002


--Set RecordIds to match the last lookup value

update RecordIDs Set ridRecNum = 530 Where ridTableName = 'Lookups'

title: Sessions not showing online
text: By default the web sessions are limited to 40 days ahead. After upgrades these are sometimes reverted. In this instance the number of days can be extended. The stored procedures in question are WEB_SessionCalendar and WEB_SessionAvailability To increase the number of days the sessions will show for online both will need to be modified. Scroll down until you find: The 40 is the number of days available online. e.g. 365 will show a year ahead. Be aware the bigger the number you set, the slower the website will be when there are large numbers of sessions. If the website is very slow after increasing this number it may need to be reduced. Some customer have an ALT set up to prevent the SPs from being overwritten: If an ALT is in place you need to modify the ALT not the original SP as this will not be looked at. It is possible to show sessions in the future including the date passed the number of days specified here. For customers such as RHS please make them aware that when they have big events we may need to reduce this number while the event is on so the website will run more efficiently.

By default the web sessions are limited to 40 days ahead.

The stored procedures in question are WEB_SessionCalendar and WEB_SessionAvailability



To increase the number of days the sessions will show for online both will need to be modified. 


Scroll down until you find:



The 40 is the number of days available online. 



e.g. 365 will show a year ahead. 


Be aware the bigger the number you set, the slower the website will be when there are large numbers of sessions. 

If the website is very slow after increasing this number it may need to be reduced.

If an ALT is in place you need to modify the ALT not the original SP as this will not be looked at. 


It is possible to show sessions in the future including the date passed the number of days specified here. 


For customers such as RHS please make them aware that when they have big events we may need to reduce this number while the event is on so the website will run more efficiently.

title: Mstore Files Not Updating On Back Office PC
text: If a customer is reporting that their Back Office PC is not updating to their MStore database version, please follow the below steps to troubleshoot this: Make sure Everyone (or at least the users using the PC) has full permissions on the C:\ProgramData\Merac & C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac folders. Check in Task Manager to make sure any of the files that are not updating are running in the background, and end the task if so. Check the correct MeracUpdater is in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac for the PC. More information on this can be found here. Make sure 7z.exe and 7z.dll files are present in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac. Check Event Viewer to see if there is an error message here. Make sure PErrTrap file isn't stuck in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\updatenewver\auth. If this is the case, please delete this file from the folder.
description:
If a customer is reporting that their Back Office PC is not updating to their MStore database version, please follow the below steps to troubleshoot this:

  • Make sure Everyone (or at least the users using the PC) has full permissions on the C:\ProgramData\Merac & C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac folders.
  • Check in Task Manager to make sure any of the files that are not updating are running in the background, and end the task if so.
  • Check the correct MeracUpdater is in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac for the PC. More information on this can be found here.
  • Make sure 7z.exe and 7z.dll files are present in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac.
  • Check Event Viewer to see if there is an error message here.
  • Make sure PErrTrap file isn't stuck in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\updatenewver\auth. If this is the case, please delete this file from the folder.

title: Error When Inserting MeracOS.exe & MeracOS.jpg Into Database During Upgrade Process
text: If you are trying to insert MeracOS.exe & MeracOS.jpg into the database to be sent out to client PC's, and you receive an error like below, this is because the system is trying to compress and rename each file to MeracOS.7z. A workaround for this is to remove the MeracOS.jpg from ...\Meracdata\updatenewver\cache, upload the other files. Then temporarily remove all the other files and upload this one file with the below button. Finally re-instate the other files in this location.

title: Check List When Till Isn't Uploading Transactions To The Database
text: If a till isn't sending its transactions up to the database, you will want to follow the below check list to make sure you have covered all these potential causes. Make sure Everyone has full control on both C:\ProgramData\Merac & C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac. Check transactions aren't stuck in TillTXNs. Make sure MeracUpdater is started, and at least restart it once anyway. Check the version of C:\Program Files (x86)\MeracUpdater.exe Check Event Viewer for any errors Make sure there are no CR+LF within any transaction files or MStore(.ini) file. If you receive the below error in Event Viewer, this is relating to CR+LF in the MStore(.ini) file. Remove all these lines and restart MeracUpdater service will resolve this particular issue.
description:
If a till isn't sending its transactions up to the database, you will want to follow the below check list to make sure you have covered all these potential causes.


  • Make sure Everyone has full control on both C:\ProgramData\Merac & C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac.
  • Check transactions aren't stuck in TillTXNs.
  • Make sure MeracUpdater is started, and at least restart it once anyway.
  • Check the version of C:\Program Files (x86)\MeracUpdater.exe
  • Check Event Viewer for any errors
  • Make sure there are no CR+LF within any transaction files or MStore(.ini) file.


If you receive the below error in Event Viewer, this is relating to CR+LF in the MStore(.ini) file. Remove all these lines and restart MeracUpdater service will resolve this particular issue.

title: Stuck Cash drawer
text: Also see: Stuck Open Cash Drawer Issue Replacing NEW or UPD TXN Files A stuck cash drawer can be a multiple of things but the main one in this solution is just when it is hiding in the background and has not been closed yet by the till operator. In other instances it is always good to check if there are stuck transactions in the database table. 1. step one is to remote on to the till and find the cash drawer in the TILLTXN file located in programdata file. 2. make sure the newtxn and updatedtxn numbers have not rescinded and are still being updated by the meracUpdater. 3. If the numbers are all looking correct you can go into the NEWTXN file and manually add the missing drawer number to the file and re open the till from the 4 button program. 4. when the till reopens the drawer should then appear under the replacement one the customer one the customer would have opened. 5. close out this till as you normally would. 6. check the merac updater is still working and the numbers by putting a transaction on and voiding all. If the numbers at the bottom of the screen update and are still matching then the customer is ready to use the cashdrawer normally and on the following day when the go to open up the cashdrawer they will be able to use the number from the cashdrawer that was stuck. 7. It is also worth checking the back office to make sure the cashdrawer is showing as closed on there. If it is not then it could be worth checking for stuck transactions as well.
description:
Also see:

Stuck Open Cash Drawer Issue

Replacing NEW or UPD TXN Files


A stuck cash drawer can be a multiple of things but the main one in this solution is just when it is hiding in the background and has not been closed yet by the till operator. In other instances it is always good to check if there are stuck transactions in the database table. 


1. step one is to remote on to the till and find the cash drawer in the TILLTXN file located in programdata file.

2. make sure the newtxn and updatedtxn numbers have not rescinded and are still being updated by the meracUpdater.

3. If the numbers are all looking correct you can go into the NEWTXN file and manually add the missing drawer number to the file and re open the till from the 4 button program.

4. when the till reopens the drawer should then appear under the replacement one the customer one the customer would have opened.

5. close out this till as you normally would.

6. check the merac updater is still working and the numbers by putting a transaction on and voiding all. If the numbers at the bottom of the screen update and are still matching then the customer is ready to use the cashdrawer normally and on the following day when the go to open up the cashdrawer they will be able to use the number from the cashdrawer that was stuck. 

7. It is also worth checking the back office to make sure the cashdrawer is showing as closed on there. If it is not then it could be worth checking for stuck transactions as well.

title: Booking Confirmation Emails Not Received - Probable Email Server Connectivity Issues
text: The following was written by Dave Radford regarding [#45768] FW: WorldPay CARD transaction confirmation: 32302659357 : K3 Support (freshdesk.com) , but has lots of general information which might be useful for other customers/situations. The details are entered into the config as normal, and the system uses these settings to connect to the external mail server and send bookings. The system will attempt to send the email and if it can’t send. It will queue them and try to resend. Process runs every hour to for all customers so won’t be on the hour for everyone. We connect to a 3rd party email server. If we can’t connect to the email server, we can only log that we timed out attempting to connect and queue it up to resend. Normally we get error messages from the remote servers however when we can’t connect the only error, we can log is our side to say we couldn’t. If there was a rejection or similar, we would get that in the error. When we can’t log anything else. Bookings can connect to the server a lot of the time, and the tests that can be run from the email templates admin section online. The below is the response I get when I try and send tests using those credentials. See enclosed too. We are now the details work and we know the website works to send them as many of the booking emails work just fine. However, at times we can’t connect to them. When we finally can it catches up and sends all the emails that are missing. Up to an hour after it returns working. As you can see, they all got sent the same time. It is unlikely a connection error to smtp.office365.com given most of our customers use office 365. The same for if a port was being blocked for a period of time our side. However, during certain times or for periods of time, we can’t connect to their mailbox. If they had a mail send limit, then we would normally get a rejection message. There Is something wrong with us accessing their systems at times. Normally when customers have issues, we provide the logs for the various examples they give us so they can trace back their side. This might be network during that time, exchange logs to see if there would be a reason. From our side we have limited options, we know we can’t connect but we won’t ever know why. We only know the why if we connect and we get an error message. If the firewall with Node4 had an issue it would affect all customers using port 587 which it doesn’t and if the internet went offline, customers wouldn’t be making bookings.
description:
The following was written by Dave Radford regarding [#45768] FW: WorldPay CARD transaction confirmation: 32302659357 : K3 Support (freshdesk.com) , but has lots of general information which might be useful for other customers/situations.


The details are entered into the config as normal, and the system uses these settings to connect to the external mail server and send bookings. 

 

 

 

The system will attempt to send the email and if it can’t send. It will queue them and try to resend. Process runs every hour to for all customers so won’t be on the hour for everyone. 

 

We connect to a 3rd party email server. If we can’t connect to the email server, we can only log that we timed out attempting to connect and queue it up to resend. Normally we get error messages from the remote servers however when we can’t connect the only error, we can log is our side to say we couldn’t. If there was a rejection or similar, we would get that in the error. When we can’t log anything else. 

 

 

 

 

Bookings can connect to the server a lot of the time, and the tests that can be run from the email templates admin section online. The below is the response I get when I try and send tests using those credentials. 

 

See enclosed too. 

 

 

 

We are now the details work and we know the website works to send them as many of the booking emails work just fine. However, at times we can’t connect to them. 

 

When we finally can it catches up and sends all the emails that are missing. Up to an hour after it returns working. 

 

As you can see, they all got sent the same time. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

It is unlikely a connection error to smtp.office365.com given most of our customers use office 365. The same for if a port was being blocked for a period of time our side. However, during certain times or for periods of time, we can’t connect to their mailbox. If they had a mail send limit, then we would normally get a rejection message. 

 

There Is something wrong with us accessing their systems at times. Normally when customers have issues, we provide the logs for the various examples they give us so they can trace back their side. This might be network during that time, exchange logs to see if there would be a reason. 

 

From our side we have limited options, we know we can’t connect but we won’t ever know why. We only know the why if we connect and we get an error message. If the firewall with Node4 had an issue it would affect all customers using port 587 which it doesn’t and if the internet went offline, customers wouldn’t be making bookings.

title: PowerBI Data Showing (Blank) In All Diagrams/Column Contains A Duplicate Value Error When Refreshing PowerBI
text: If diagrams on PowerBI are showing (Blank) and trying to refresh the data displays a similar error as below, it means that there is a duplicate record in MStore, which is not valid with how the PowerBI relationship has been setup. To fix this specific issue, I found that there were two privilege schemes for one member in AccPrivilege in the MStore database. FYI, the above value referenced above '44547_1' is in the format of [AccRecNo]_[CusSeq]. SELECT * FROM Account LEFT JOIN Customer ON AccRecNo=CusAccRecNo LEFT JOIN AccPrivilege ON accRecNo=prvAccRecNo AND cusSeq=prvCusSeq --LEFT JOIN Address ON accRecNo=addAccRecNo --AND cusSeq=addSeq WHERE accBranch=1 --AND AccAccNum IN ('','','') AND accRecNo IN ('44547','','') --AND cusCardNum IN ('44547_1','','') SELECT * INTO BAKAccPrivilege17May2024 FROM AccPrivilege BEGIN TRANSACTION DELETE FROM AccPrivilege WHERE prvAccRecNo=44547 AND prvCusSeq=1 AND prvCode='ADMEMDDM' --COMMIT
description:
If diagrams on PowerBI are showing (Blank) and trying to refresh the data displays a similar error as below, it means that there is a duplicate record in MStore, which is not valid with how the PowerBI relationship has been setup.



To fix this specific issue, I found that there were two privilege schemes for one member in AccPrivilege in the MStore database. FYI, the above value referenced above '44547_1' is in the format of [AccRecNo]_[CusSeq].


SELECT * FROM Account 
LEFT JOIN Customer ON AccRecNo=CusAccRecNo 
LEFT JOIN AccPrivilege ON accRecNo=prvAccRecNo AND cusSeq=prvCusSeq 
--LEFT JOIN Address ON accRecNo=addAccRecNo --AND cusSeq=addSeq 
WHERE accBranch=1 
--AND AccAccNum IN ('','','') 
AND accRecNo IN ('44547','','') 
--AND cusCardNum IN ('44547_1','','') 

SELECT * INTO BAKAccPrivilege17May2024 FROM AccPrivilege

BEGIN TRANSACTION 
DELETE FROM AccPrivilege
WHERE prvAccRecNo=44547 AND prvCusSeq=1 AND prvCode='ADMEMDDM'
--COMMIT

title: Various Issues With Printing To Kitchen Printers From The POS
text: If a customer is experiencing issues with kitchen orders not printing, or other issues relating to the kitchen printers, then you will want to apply these changes to the kitchen printers Printer Preferences on each till the kitchen printer is installed on: Open Devices and Printers. Right-click on the kitchen printer in question, and click on Printer Preferences. In the Main tab, choose the lowest Resolution (80 x 72), and choose Color to Monochrome. Click Apply and OK. Once this is done, have the customer monitor this situation to see if their issue persists.
description:
If a customer is experiencing issues with kitchen orders not printing, or other issues relating to the kitchen printers, then you will want to apply these changes to the kitchen printers Printer Preferences on each till the kitchen printer is installed on:


  1. Open Devices and Printers.
  2. Right-click on the kitchen printer in question, and click on Printer Preferences.
  3. In the Main tab, choose the lowest Resolution (80 x 72), and choose Color to Monochrome.
  4. Click Apply and OK.

Once this is done, have the customer monitor this situation to see if their issue persists.

title: Removing incorrect DD submissions
text: If an incorrect batch has been submit the system will not pick them up again as far as it's concerned they have been sent to the bank to be dealt with, in this case all payments up to 30 Apr 26. It is possible to remove them providing they have NOT been submit to the bank. DO NOT REMOVE A BATCH IF IT HAS BEEN SENT TO THE BANK. --------------- First you need to remove the link within AccountDDPayments to the incorrect batch: begin transaction Update AccountDDPayments Set adpSubmissionNo = 0 Where adpSubmissionNo = 59 --commit (Ensure you commit the change after running begin transaction) Replace batch 59 with the incorrect submission number. You then need to remove the header and detail entries: begin transaction Delete from DDSubmissionDet Where dsdBatchNo = 59 --commit begin transaction Delete from DDSubmissionHdr Where dshBatchNo = 59 --commit ----------------- Repeat for any subsequent batches. (Removed 61 in this instance) Generate New Submission:
description:
If an incorrect batch has been submit the system will not pick them up again as far as it's concerned they have been sent to the bank to be dealt with, in this case all payments up to 30 Apr 26. 


It is possible to remove them providing they have NOT been submit to the bank. 



DO NOT REMOVE A BATCH IF IT HAS BEEN SENT TO THE BANK. 


---------------


First you need to remove the link within AccountDDPayments to the incorrect batch:


begin transaction

Update AccountDDPayments 

Set adpSubmissionNo = 0

Where adpSubmissionNo = 59

--commit


(Ensure you commit the change after running begin transaction)


Replace batch 59 with the incorrect submission number. 


You then need to remove the header and detail entries:


begin transaction

Delete from DDSubmissionDet 

Where dsdBatchNo = 59

--commit


begin transaction

Delete from DDSubmissionHdr 

Where dshBatchNo = 59

--commit


-----------------


Repeat for any subsequent batches.


(Removed 61 in this instance)



Generate New Submission:

title: "Please Select One Ticket" When Tickets Already Select On A Booking Page
text: If you select one or all resources on a booking template, and it states "Please select one ticket", and checking all of the setup of the booking template, resources, PLU's, Session Type and Sessions, then try removing one resource from the booking template at a time, and then adding an item to the basket. I performed this on ticket: https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/tickets/53263, where I found PLU causing this, and dirtied the record, reverted the changes, saved, updated website templates. This fixed the issue.
description:

title: WorldPay IPP350 RAM Update - 0973 to 1606
text: To update the RAM version for IPP350s please follow the below instructions: The required files are here: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/xhpk4i5yepdozs4iyz106/RAM0973toRAM1606.zip?rlkey=xjonanjps0ebhtamwq5f1slce&st=cv377h1c&dl=0 1. Close the IPC application. 2. Create a new folder in the YESEFT directory and name it “FirmwareUpgrade” 3. Unzip the attached file to the location YESEFT\FirmwareUpgrade 4. Now go to YESEFT and Run the StartPOSServer.batch file to initialize the IPC software 5. The application will now start upgrading the firmware. When completed, IPC will be initialized with the new firmware version.
description:
To update the RAM version for IPP350s please follow the below instructions:


The required files are here: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/xhpk4i5yepdozs4iyz106/RAM0973toRAM1606.zip?rlkey=xjonanjps0ebhtamwq5f1slce&st=cv377h1c&dl=0


1. Close the IPC application.
2. Create a new folder in the YESEFT directory and name it “FirmwareUpgrade”
3. Unzip the attached file to the location YESEFT\FirmwareUpgrade
4. Now go to YESEFT and Run the StartPOSServer.batch file to initialize the IPC software
5. The application will now start upgrading the firmware. When completed, IPC will be initialized with the new firmware version.

title: Paignton Zoo / Newquay Zoo Member sync process
text: The membership sync has now been set up between the Paignton Zoo and Newquay Zoo databases. Both databases are on the same server, however members can buy a joint membership at both Zoo's meaning they need to exist in both databases. Within Windows services you will now find the below services: MeracCopyMembersAcrossDBsNZoo copies the members from Paignton Zoo database to the Newquay Zoo database. MeracCopyMembersAcrossDBsPZoo copies the members from the Newquay Zoo database to the Paignton Zoo database. Troubleshooting: The services log to Event Viewer, however this is only limited logging. Extended logging can be enabled within the service folder: Writes to the Debug Log. (If you enable this, PLEASE ensure you turn it off once you are done problem solving as it fills up very quickly) Within the Paignton Zoo database you will find the below tables: Select * from AccountToSyncNZOODB Select * from CustomerToSyncNZOODB Select * from PhotosToSyncNZOODB Select * from AddressToSyncNZOODB Select * from AccPrivilegeToSyncNZOODB This is a list of the memberships that are currently processing. If a member gets stuck in one of those tables you will need to check why. Within the Newquay Zoo database you will find the tables: Select * from AccountToSyncPZOODB Select * from CustomerToSyncPZOODB Select * from PhotosToSyncPZOODB Select * from AddressToSyncPZOODB Select * from AccPrivilegeToSyncPZOODB
description:
The membership sync has now been set up between the Paignton Zoo and Newquay Zoo databases. 


Both databases are on the same server, however members can buy a joint membership at both Zoo's meaning they need to exist in both databases. 


Within Windows services you will now find the below services:



MeracCopyMembersAcrossDBsNZoo copies the members from Paignton Zoo database to the Newquay Zoo database.

MeracCopyMembersAcrossDBsPZoo copies the members from the Newquay Zoo database to the Paignton Zoo database.


Troubleshooting:


The services log to Event Viewer, however this is only limited logging.

Writes to the Debug Log.

Within the Paignton Zoo database you will find the below tables:


Select * from AccountToSyncNZOODB

Select * from PhotosToSyncNZOODB

Select * from AddressToSyncNZOODB

Select * from AccPrivilegeToSyncNZOODB


This is a list of the memberships that are currently processing. If a member gets stuck in one of those tables you will need to check why. 



Within the Newquay Zoo database you will find the tables: 


Select * from AccountToSyncPZOODB

Select * from CustomerToSyncPZOODB

Select * from PhotosToSyncPZOODB

Select * from AccPrivilegeToSyncPZOODB

title: Tills With Timeline View Not Showing Sessions In Timeline and Regularly Showing Offline
text: Issue Tills that use the session timeline view, but show as below, and tills are regularly going offline. Fix This issue is caused by a session location that links to the sessions that are displayed on this till, has been deleted or its identifier has changed. To fix this, you need to resurrect this session location. The quickest way to do this is to setup a new session location with the session location ID that matches the one of the affected session in SessionHdr. Then do the same for SessionTypeLocationLink. There is SQL below that will help with this. SELECT * FROM LookupGroups SELECT * FROM Lookups WHERE lkuGroupCode IN ('19') SELECT * FROM SessionLocations SELECT * FROM SessionHdr WHERE shdRecNo= SELECT * FROM SessionHdr WHERE shdSesLocId= BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE SessionLocations SET slcSesLocId= WHERE slcSesLocId= --COMMIT BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE SessionHdr SET shdSesLocId= WHERE shdSesLocId= --COMMIT SELECT * FROM SessionTypeLocationLink BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE SessionTypeLocationLink SET tllSesLocId= WHERE tllSesLocId= --COMMIT

title: Session Availability Not Calculating Correctly Online (Re-Calculate Sessions Hourly)
text: In order to combat the issues where the sessions availability is not showing the correct availability, you will need to apply the attached MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS stored procedure to the MStore database, that will allow this to run on an hourly basis, to keep the availability correct. I have also added an _ALT stored procedure, as the upgrade process seems to revert this stored procedure back. ALTER PROCEDURE [dbo].[MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS] AS /*=============================================================================== Change History ================================================================================= Date: Author: Description: 26/03/2018 JMD Return number of reservations cancelled 12/10/2018 CDK Added check for ALT version 30/01/2023 VS Clear SessionBkgs and SessionSeats 16/02/2023 VS Extended to undo AccPrivilege update 13/07/2023 VS Reset booking ref for walkups 12/04/2024 VS corrected subquery in insert @tITA to exclude recent (within 2 hours) records with unpaid status for the same member =================================================================================*/ SET NOCOUNT OFF; if exists(Select * from sysobjects where name like 'MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_Alt') begin exec MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_Alt RETURN end declare @tBkh table (bkRef int) insert @tBkh select bkhRef from Bkgheader where bkhBranch=1 and bkhStatus='R' and ISNULL(bkhIsInternet,0)=1 and datediff(minute,bkhBookedOn,getdate()) >= 60 UPDATE dbo.Bkgheader SET bkhStatus='Z', bkhNotes='Unpaid reservation' WHERE bkhBranch=1 and bkhRef in (select bkRef from @tBkh) DELETE SessionBkgs Where sesBranch = 1 and sesbkhRef in (select bkRef from @tBkh) DELETE SessionSeats Where sstBranch = 1 and sstSesBkhRef in (select bkRef from @tBkh) declare @tITA table(itaID int) insert @tITA select itaID from InternetTransactionAudit ITA where isnull(itatxhNo,0) = 0 and isnull(itaPaidStatus,0)= 0 and isnull(itaCreationAction,'') != 'MC_SaveBooking' and isnull(itaCusCardNum,'0') !='0' and DATEDIFF(mi,itaDateStamp, GETDATE()) between 61 and 120 -- itaDateStamp > DATEADD(mi,-61,GETDATE()) and not exists(select * from InternetTransactionAudit A where A.itaAccRecNo = ITA.itaAccRecNo and A.itaCusSeq = ITA.itaCusSeq and isnull(A.itaPaidStatus,0) !=0 and isnull(A.itatxhNo,0) !=0 and DATEDIFF(mi,A.itaDateStamp, ITA.itaDateStamp) 0 and sesName like '%Walkup%' declare @tSes table (RecNo int) declare @sesRecNo int insert @tSes select shdRecNo from SessionHdr where datediff(day,getdate(),shdDateTime) >= 0 WHILE EXISTS(SELECT * FROM @tSes) BEGIN select top 1 @sesRecNo = RecNo from @tSes exec MC_SeatAvailability @Branch = 1, @SesRecNo = @sesRecNo delete @tSes where recno = @sesRecNo END GO Once you have added this stored procedure, you will want to run the below of the SQL above as a one off to re-calculate the session availability. declare @tSes table (RecNo int) declare @sesRecNo int insert @tSes select shdRecNo from SessionHdr where datediff(day,getdate(),shdDateTime) >= 0 WHILE EXISTS(SELECT * FROM @tSes) BEGIN select top 1 @sesRecNo = RecNo from @tSes exec MC_SeatAvailability @Branch = 1, @SesRecNo = @sesRecNo delete @tSes where recno = @sesRecNo END GO
description:
In order to combat the issues where the sessions availability is not showing the correct availability, you will need to apply the attached MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS stored procedure to the MStore database, that will allow this to run on an hourly basis, to keep the availability correct.


I have also added an _ALT stored procedure, as the upgrade process seems to revert this stored procedure back.


ALTER PROCEDURE [dbo].[MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS]
AS
/*===============================================================================
Change History                                                                  
=================================================================================
Date:         Author:  Description:                                  
26/03/2018    JMD      Return number of reservations cancelled
12/10/2018    CDK      Added check for ALT version
30/01/2023    VS     Clear SessionBkgs and SessionSeats
16/02/2023    VS     Extended to undo AccPrivilege update
13/07/2023    VS     Reset booking ref for walkups
12/04/2024    VS     corrected subquery in insert @tITA to exclude recent (within 2 hours) records with unpaid status for the same member 
=================================================================================*/
SET NOCOUNT OFF;

if exists(Select * from sysobjects where name like 'MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_Alt')
begin
  exec MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_Alt
  RETURN
end

declare @tBkh table (bkRef int)
insert @tBkh select bkhRef from Bkgheader where bkhBranch=1 and bkhStatus='R' and ISNULL(bkhIsInternet,0)=1  and datediff(minute,bkhBookedOn,getdate()) >= 60

UPDATE dbo.Bkgheader 
SET bkhStatus='Z', bkhNotes='Unpaid reservation' 
  WHERE bkhBranch=1 and bkhRef in (select bkRef from  @tBkh)

DELETE SessionBkgs Where sesBranch = 1 and sesbkhRef in (select bkRef from  @tBkh)

DELETE SessionSeats  Where sstBranch  = 1 and sstSesBkhRef  in (select bkRef from  @tBkh)

declare @tITA table(itaID int)

insert @tITA 
       select itaID 
       from InternetTransactionAudit ITA
where isnull(itatxhNo,0) = 0 and isnull(itaPaidStatus,0)= 0 and isnull(itaCreationAction,'') != 'MC_SaveBooking' and isnull(itaCusCardNum,'0') !='0'  
       and DATEDIFF(mi,itaDateStamp, GETDATE()) between 61 and 120   -- itaDateStamp > DATEADD(mi,-61,GETDATE()) 
       and not exists(select * from InternetTransactionAudit A where A.itaAccRecNo = ITA.itaAccRecNo and A.itaCusSeq = ITA.itaCusSeq and isnull(A.itaPaidStatus,0) !=0 and isnull(A.itatxhNo,0) !=0
                                                                           and DATEDIFF(mi,A.itaDateStamp, ITA.itaDateStamp) < 120 ) -- corrected by VS on 12/04/2024
UPDATE AccPrivilege set 
                prvDateExpires=itaOrigExpiryDate 
              , prvDateRenewed = case pvtDurationUnits 
                                                when 'd'  then dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(day,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))
                                                when 'm'  then dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(month,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))
                                                when 'ww' then dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(WEEK,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))
                                                when 'q'  then dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(QUARTER,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))
                                                else          dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(YEAR,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))
                                         end


from InternetTransactionAudit ITA
join AccPrivilege on prvAccRecNo = itaAccRecNo and prvCusSeq = itaCusSeq
join PrivilegeSchemes on pvtCode = prvCode
where itaID in (select itaID from @tITA)

delete AccPrivilege_History 
from AccPrivilege_History 
join InternetTransactionAudit ITA on prvhAccRecNo = itaAccRecNo and prvhCusSeq = itaCusSeq
where itaID in (select itaID from @tITA)

update SessionBkgs set sesbkhRef=0,sesBkdSeq=0 where  sesbkhref >0 and sesName like '%Walkup%' 

declare @tSes table (RecNo int)  
declare @sesRecNo int
insert @tSes select shdRecNo from SessionHdr where datediff(day,getdate(),shdDateTime) >= 0 

WHILE EXISTS(SELECT * FROM @tSes)
BEGIN  
  select top 1 @sesRecNo = RecNo from @tSes
  exec MC_SeatAvailability @Branch = 1, @SesRecNo = @sesRecNo
  delete @tSes where recno = @sesRecNo
END
GO

Once you have added this stored procedure, you will want to run the below of the SQL above as a one off to re-calculate the session availability.


declare @tSes table (RecNo int)  
declare @sesRecNo int
insert @tSes select shdRecNo from SessionHdr where datediff(day,getdate(),shdDateTime) >= 0 

WHILE EXISTS(SELECT * FROM @tSes)
BEGIN  
  select top 1 @sesRecNo = RecNo from @tSes
  exec MC_SeatAvailability @Branch = 1, @SesRecNo = @sesRecNo
  delete @tSes where recno = @sesRecNo
END
GO

title: Installing Merac PDB as a service
text: Get latest PDBUpdater.exe from latest release folder; \\svrcompany\ftproot\support\ver3.18.X Edit DBUpdate.ini file to point to correct database and put in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\ (Format as below) Run the below in CMD (as admin): "C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\installutil.exe" "C:\Program Files (X86)\Merac\PDBUpdater.exe" Stop/Start MeracPDB service a couple times. --------------- If the transactions don't process you can check for errors in event viewer.
