title: Tills Freezing/Running Slow
text: If you are experiencing tills are running slow, you may want to consider making sure of the below check: Reboot till. Make sure the latest version of MeracUpdater is used on all the affected tills. Make sure the database isn't too defragmented. Consider that the customer sets up a deframenter process as a scheduled maintenance process that is run weekly outside of working hours. Make sure that if there is antivirus software on the tills, that on-access scanning has the exception on the C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac & C:\ProgramData\Merac folder locations, or have this disabled entirely if not. Unblock MStore files if they have been downloaded over a web browser. Run sfc /scannow and chkdsk /f in CMD. Create or increase paging file size.
description:
If you are experiencing tills are running slow, you may want to consider making sure of the below check:


  • Reboot till.
  • Make sure the latest version of MeracUpdater is used on all the affected tills.
  • Make sure the database isn't too defragmented. Consider that the customer sets up a deframenter process as a scheduled maintenance process that is run weekly outside of working hours.
  • Make sure that if there is antivirus software on the tills, that on-access scanning has the exception on the C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac & C:\ProgramData\Merac folder locations, or have this disabled entirely if not.
  • Unblock MStore files if they have been downloaded over a web browser.
  • Run sfc /scannow and chkdsk /f in CMD.
  • Create or increase paging file size.

title: Error When Using Tesco Voucher For Payment
text: If a customer is recently reporting issues with redeeming Tesco Vouchers for payment from the 11th September 2024. Tesco updated their Tesco Voucher Verification API, as you can see below. From: Clubcard_Partner_Ops Sent: 16 September 2024 09:12 To: Denise Coates Cc: Jemma Benton ; Clark, Heather ; Coughtrey, Dale Subject: RE: Hawk Conservancy Trust- Tesco vouchers not being accepted in gift shop. Hi Denise & Jemma Apologies for not contacting you sooner, our mailbox is only monitored Mon-Fri. We did make a change on Wednesday Sep 11th that could be affecting your redemptions. Please can you pass the following information onto your software provider to check: We recently sent an email to all our Reward Partners with notice that Tesco are performing a security upgrade, your tech team are best placed to check that all is in order. Are you able to check with your tech team that the cipher has been upgraded please? The following information may be useful for them. If you have updated your SDK (Software Development Kit) and are successfully accessing the clubcard.api.tesco.com domain please see below some additional information on how to check the Cipher version you are using. There are 3 options. From the client side they will need to inspect the client ‘handshake packet’ (it’s called “client Hello” , that’s how it’ll show up in the packet capture tools ) there are tools like Wireshark etc. that can be used to be absolutely certain Open ssl s_client -connect http://clubcard.api.tesco.com:443 or opening up (https://www.howsmyssl.com/a/check_) from their application server . Here’s a reminder of the supported Cipher versions. Supported Cipher Versions: The below cipher versions will be supported after the upgrade. TLSv1.2:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 TLSv1.2:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 TLSv1.2:ECDHE-RSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305 TLSv1.3:TLS-AES-256-GCM-SHA384 TLSv1.3:TLS-CHACHA20-POLY1305-SHA256 Details of the decommissioned ciphers are available here https://community.akamai.com/customers/s/article/SSL-TLS-Cipher-Profiles-for-Akamai-Secure-CDNrxdxm?language=en_US Let me know if you need any further information. Many thanks Susan Susan Burrows Clubcard Partner Operations Team Membership & Loyalty Fix Therefore, we have moved our integration from the SHOP server to SHOP2. For this reason, the MeracProxyService.exe.config file (located along with the service location, usually C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac) needs to be updated with a two, highlighted in red below: http://shop2.myonlinebooking.co.uk:22230/MeracTescoAPIWebProxy/TescoBoost.asmx Once this is done, restart the MeracProxyService service.
description:
If a customer is recently reporting issues with redeeming Tesco Vouchers for payment from the 11th September 2024. Tesco updated their Tesco Voucher Verification API, as you can see below.


From: Clubcard_Partner_Ops <Clubcard_Partner_Ops@tesco.com>
Sent: 16 September 2024 09:12
To: Denise Coates <denise@hawkconservancy.org>
Cc: Jemma Benton <Jemma@hawkconservancy.org>; Clark, Heather <Heather.Clark1@tesco.com>; Coughtrey, Dale <Dale.Coughtrey@tesco.com>
Subject: RE: Hawk Conservancy Trust- Tesco vouchers not being accepted in gift shop.
 
Hi Denise & Jemma
 
Apologies for not contacting you sooner, our mailbox is only monitored Mon-Fri. 
 
We did make a change on Wednesday Sep 11th that could be affecting your redemptions.  Please can you pass the following information onto your software provider to check:
 
We recently sent an email to all our Reward Partners with notice that Tesco are performing a security upgrade, your tech team are best placed to check that all is in order.
 
Are you able to check with your tech team that the cipher has been upgraded please?  The following information may be useful for them.
 
If you have updated  your SDK (Software Development Kit) and are successfully accessing  the clubcard.api.tesco.com domain please see below some additional information on how to check the Cipher version you are using. There are 3 options.
 
  1. From the client side they will need to  inspect the client ‘handshake packet’ (it’s called “client Hello” , that’s how it’ll show up in the packet capture tools ) there are tools like Wireshark etc. that can be used to be absolutely certain
 
  1. Open ssl s_client -connect http://clubcard.api.tesco.com:443
 
  1. or opening up (https://www.howsmyssl.com/a/check_) from their application server
.
Here’s a reminder of the supported Cipher versions.
 
Supported Cipher Versions:
 
               The below cipher versions will be supported after the upgrade.
 
TLSv1.2:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256
TLSv1.2:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
TLSv1.2:ECDHE-RSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305
TLSv1.3:TLS-AES-256-GCM-SHA384
TLSv1.3:TLS-CHACHA20-POLY1305-SHA256
 
Details of the decommissioned ciphers are available here https://community.akamai.com/customers/s/article/SSL-TLS-Cipher-Profiles-for-Akamai-Secure-CDNrxdxm?language=en_US
 
Let me know if you need any further information.
 
Many thanks
 
Susan
 
Susan Burrows
Clubcard Partner Operations Team
Membership & Loyalty


Fix

Therefore, we have moved our integration from the SHOP server to SHOP2. For this reason, the MeracProxyService.exe.config file (located along with the service location, usually C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac) needs to be updated with a two, highlighted in red below:


<setting name="MeracProxyService_MeracTescoAPIWebProxy_MeracTescoAPIWebProxy"

          serializeAs="String">

          <value>http://shop2.myonlinebooking.co.uk:22230/MeracTescoAPIWebProxy/TescoBoost.asmx</value>

        </setting>


Once this is done, restart the MeracProxyService service.

title: Primary Key Error When Zeroising Stock
text: If a customer receives a primary key error when zeroising their stock, then they would have had an issue with their previous stock zeroise, where the process of inserting stock movements into the StockMovements table was interrupted or no movements was needed to be inserted. This error occurs because the system finds the last zeroise ID from the StockMovements table (SQL statement below). So if there were none, the system wouldn't find the latest stock zeroise ID in StockZeroise. Select isnull(Max(stmLinkRecNo), 0) as LastZeroise from StockMovements Where stmMoveType = 8 For the time being, backup the table and remove this record. SQL below: --Compare max stock zeroise ID Select isnull(Max(stmLinkRecNo), 0) as LastZeroise from StockMovements Where stmMoveType = 8 SELECT TOP 2 * FROM StockZeroise ORDER BY stzId DESC --Create Backup Table DECLARE @SQL NVARCHAR(100) = 'SELECT * INTO BAKStockZeroise'+ REPLACE(CONVERT(NVARCHAR, GETDATE(), 6),' ','') +' FROM StockZeroise' EXEC (@SQL) --Delete any StockZeroise records that is more than the number in the StockMovements BEGIN TRANSACTION DELETE FROM StockZeroise WHERE stzId > (Select isnull(Max(stmLinkRecNo), 0) as LastZeroise from StockMovements Where stmMoveType = 8) --COMMIT
description:
If a customer receives a primary key error when zeroising their stock, then they would have had an issue with their previous stock zeroise, where the process of inserting stock movements into the StockMovements table was interrupted or no movements was needed to be inserted.




This error occurs because the system finds the last zeroise ID from the StockMovements table (SQL statement below). So if there were none, the system wouldn't find the latest stock zeroise ID in StockZeroise.


Select isnull(Max(stmLinkRecNo), 0) as LastZeroise from StockMovements Where stmMoveType = 8


For the time being, backup the table and remove this record. SQL below:


--Compare max stock zeroise ID
Select isnull(Max(stmLinkRecNo), 0) as LastZeroise from StockMovements Where stmMoveType = 8
SELECT TOP 2 * FROM StockZeroise
ORDER BY stzId DESC

--Create Backup Table
DECLARE @SQL NVARCHAR(100) = 'SELECT * INTO BAKStockZeroise'+ REPLACE(CONVERT(NVARCHAR, GETDATE(), 6),' ','') +' FROM StockZeroise'
EXEC (@SQL)

--Delete any StockZeroise records that is more than the number in the StockMovements
BEGIN TRANSACTION 
DELETE FROM StockZeroise
WHERE stzId > (Select isnull(Max(stmLinkRecNo), 0) as LastZeroise from StockMovements Where stmMoveType = 8)
--COMMIT

title: Reserved Basket Timing
text: By default the system will clear any reserved bookings that have not received a payment after 1 hour (60 minutes) It is however possible to update this. Please don't change it to anything less than 15 minutes otherwise it doesn't give the customer long enough to make a payment online. To do so: Find the stored procedure MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS By default it's set to 60 minutes: You can update this value to be the number of minutes required. Alternately, if it's a site that gets updated regularly or just to prevent it from getting overwritten by the update scripts you can add in an ALT. Run the below: -------------------------------- USE [MStore] GO /****** Object: StoredProcedure [dbo].[MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_ALT] Script Date: 20/01/2025 10:20:40 ******/ SET ANSI_NULLS ON GO SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON GO CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_ALT] AS /*=============================================================================== Change History ================================================================================= Date: Author: Description: 26/03/2018 JMD Return number of reservations cancelled 12/10/2018 CDK Added check for ALT version 30/01/2023 VS Clear SessionBkgs and SessionSeats 16/02/2023 VS Extended to undo AccPrivilege update 13/07/2023 VS Reset booking ref for walkups 12/04/2024 VS corrected subquery in insert @tITA to exclude recent (within 2 hours) records with unpaid status for the same member =================================================================================*/ SET NOCOUNT OFF; declare @tBkh table (bkRef int) insert @tBkh select bkhRef from Bkgheader where bkhBranch=1 and bkhStatus='R' and ISNULL(bkhIsInternet,0)=1 and datediff(minute,bkhBookedOn,getdate()) >= 15 UPDATE dbo.Bkgheader SET bkhStatus='Z', bkhNotes='Unpaid reservation' WHERE bkhBranch=1 and bkhRef in (select bkRef from @tBkh) DELETE SessionBkgs Where sesBranch = 1 and sesbkhRef in (select bkRef from @tBkh) DELETE SessionSeats Where sstBranch = 1 and sstSesBkhRef in (select bkRef from @tBkh) declare @tITA table(itaID int) insert @tITA select itaID from InternetTransactionAudit ITA where isnull(itatxhNo,0) = 0 and isnull(itaPaidStatus,0)= 0 and isnull(itaCreationAction,'') != 'MC_SaveBooking' and isnull(itaCusCardNum,'0') !='0' and DATEDIFF(mi,itaDateStamp, GETDATE()) between 61 and 120 -- itaDateStamp > DATEADD(mi,-61,GETDATE()) and not exists(select * from InternetTransactionAudit A where A.itaAccRecNo = ITA.itaAccRecNo and A.itaCusSeq = ITA.itaCusSeq and isnull(A.itaPaidStatus,0) !=0 and isnull(A.itatxhNo,0) !=0 and DATEDIFF(mi,A.itaDateStamp, ITA.itaDateStamp) 0 and sesName like '%Walkup%' declare @tSes table (RecNo int) declare @sesRecNo int insert @tSes select shdRecNo from SessionHdr where datediff(day,getdate(),shdDateTime) >= 0 WHILE EXISTS(SELECT * FROM @tSes) BEGIN select top 1 @sesRecNo = RecNo from @tSes exec MC_SeatAvailability @Branch = 1, @SesRecNo = @sesRecNo delete @tSes where recno = @sesRecNo END -------------------------------- Change CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_ALT] back to ALTER PROCEDURE: Execure the SP to save the change.
description:
By default the system will clear any reserved bookings that have not received a payment after 1 hour (60 minutes)


It is however possible to update this. Please don't change it to anything less than 15 minutes otherwise it doesn't give the customer long enough to make a payment online. 


To do so:


Find the stored procedure MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS



By default it's set to 60 minutes:



You can update this value to be the number of minutes required. 


Alternately, if it's a site that gets updated regularly or just to prevent it from getting overwritten by the update scripts you can add in an ALT. 


Run the below:


--------------------------------


USE [MStore]

GO

/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_ALT]    Script Date: 20/01/2025 10:20:40 ******/

SET ANSI_NULLS ON

GO

SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON

GO



CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_ALT]

AS

/*===============================================================================

Change History                                                                  

=================================================================================

Date:         Author:  Description:                                  

26/03/2018    JMD      Return number of reservations cancelled

12/10/2018    CDK      Added check for ALT version

30/01/2023      VS       Clear SessionBkgs and SessionSeats

16/02/2023      VS       Extended to undo AccPrivilege update

13/07/2023      VS       Reset booking ref for walkups

12/04/2024      VS       corrected subquery in insert @tITA to exclude recent (within 2 hours) records with unpaid status for the same member 

=================================================================================*/

SET NOCOUNT OFF;


declare @tBkh table (bkRef int)

insert @tBkh select bkhRef from Bkgheader where bkhBranch=1 and bkhStatus='R' and ISNULL(bkhIsInternet,0)=1  and datediff(minute,bkhBookedOn,getdate()) >= 15


UPDATE dbo.Bkgheader 

SET bkhStatus='Z', bkhNotes='Unpaid reservation' 

    WHERE bkhBranch=1 and bkhRef in (select bkRef from  @tBkh)


DELETE SessionBkgs Where sesBranch = 1 and sesbkhRef in (select bkRef from  @tBkh)


DELETE SessionSeats  Where sstBranch  = 1 and sstSesBkhRef  in (select bkRef from  @tBkh)


declare @tITA table(itaID int)


insert @tITA 

       select itaID 

       from InternetTransactionAudit ITA

where isnull(itatxhNo,0) = 0 and isnull(itaPaidStatus,0)= 0 and isnull(itaCreationAction,'') != 'MC_SaveBooking' and isnull(itaCusCardNum,'0') !='0'  

       and DATEDIFF(mi,itaDateStamp, GETDATE()) between 61 and 120   -- itaDateStamp > DATEADD(mi,-61,GETDATE()) 

       and not exists(select * from InternetTransactionAudit A where A.itaAccRecNo = ITA.itaAccRecNo and A.itaCusSeq = ITA.itaCusSeq and isnull(A.itaPaidStatus,0) !=0 and isnull(A.itatxhNo,0) !=0

                                                                           and DATEDIFF(mi,A.itaDateStamp, ITA.itaDateStamp) < 120 ) -- corrected by VS on 12/04/2024

UPDATE AccPrivilege set 

                prvDateExpires=itaOrigExpiryDate 

              , prvDateRenewed = case pvtDurationUnits 

                                                when 'd'  then dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(day,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))

                                                when 'm'  then dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(month,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))

                                                when 'ww' then dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(WEEK,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))

                                                when 'q'  then dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(QUARTER,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))

                                                else          dateadd(day, 1,dateadd(YEAR,-pvtDuration, itaOrigExpiryDate))

                                         end



from InternetTransactionAudit ITA

join AccPrivilege on prvAccRecNo = itaAccRecNo and prvCusSeq = itaCusSeq

join PrivilegeSchemes on pvtCode = prvCode

where itaID in (select itaID from @tITA)


delete AccPrivilege_History 

from AccPrivilege_History 

join InternetTransactionAudit ITA on prvhAccRecNo = itaAccRecNo and prvhCusSeq = itaCusSeq

where itaID in (select itaID from @tITA)


update SessionBkgs set sesbkhRef=0,sesBkdSeq=0 where  sesbkhref >0 and sesName like '%Walkup%' 


declare @tSes table (RecNo int)  

declare @sesRecNo int

insert @tSes select shdRecNo from SessionHdr where datediff(day,getdate(),shdDateTime) >= 0 


WHILE EXISTS(SELECT * FROM @tSes)

BEGIN    

    select top 1 @sesRecNo = RecNo from @tSes

    exec MC_SeatAvailability @Branch = 1, @SesRecNo = @sesRecNo

    delete @tSes where recno = @sesRecNo

END


--------------------------------


Change CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[MC_CancelInternetUnpaidReservationsWS_ALT] back to ALTER PROCEDURE:


Execure the SP to save the change.

title: Internal FAQ's On Selling Variants On Shopify
text: The stock record description for each variant has to be unique in order for the item to upload to Shopify. If the stock records are the same, you will get the below errors circled in red. Once the stock description has been updated, the products will upload, as you can see circled in green.
description:
The stock record description for each variant has to be unique in order for the item to upload to Shopify.




If the stock records are the same, you will get the below errors circled in red. Once the stock description has been updated, the products will upload, as you can see circled in green.

title: Shopify Sync Stopped
text: If a customer reports that Shopify has stopped uploading new items 1. Give the Shopify service a restart: 2. check the K3ShopifyErrorLog Select * from K3ShopifyErrorLog Order by kelDatestamp desc If this doesn't show any errors (excluding the exceeds 2 calls per seconds for api client errors) 3. Check Event Viewer: This error effectively means there is an item without a valid price which stops the sync! You can run: [p_K3Shopify_FetchMStoreProducts] This will give a list of all Shopify products set up within MStore: Scroll through the prices until you find an item with a NULL in the price field: Either remove the item from the list of items that Shopify will upload or update the price so it is valid for future: Restart the Shopify service, check event viewer to ensure the error message has gone.
description:
If a customer reports that Shopify has stopped uploading new items


1. Give the Shopify service a restart:



2. check the K3ShopifyErrorLog


Select * from K3ShopifyErrorLog

Order by kelDatestamp desc

 


If this doesn't show any errors (excluding the exceeds 2 calls per seconds for api client errors) 


3. Check Event Viewer:



This error effectively means there is an item without a valid price which stops the sync!


You can run: [p_K3Shopify_FetchMStoreProducts]


This will give a list of all Shopify products set up within MStore:



Scroll through the prices until you find an item with a NULL in the price field:



Either remove the item from the list of items that Shopify will upload or update the price so it is valid for future:



Restart the Shopify service, check event viewer to ensure the error message has gone.

title: Payment Failed When Clicking Pay Now/Renew page refreshes When Clicking Renew On The Website
text: If a customer is reporting that they are getting Payment Failed when they press Pay Now or the the page refreshes when they click Renew on the renewal page for membership renewals, this is likely due to the Renewal cost for the membership selected does not have a valid internet price for the PLU linked to Membship Price in Membership Types. You can check this by running the below stored procedure, making sure there are no NULL fields in the RenewCost column. [dbo].[MC_RetrieveMembershipSchemes] If there are NULL's in any of the records, go into the Membship Price PLU, then View/Add Price, make a change and put it back (change date field up a year and then down again), then press Apply. This will then resolve the issue.
description:
If a customer is reporting that they are getting Payment Failed when they press Pay Now or the the page refreshes when they click Renew on the renewal page for membership renewals, this is likely due to the Renewal cost for the membership selected does not have a valid internet price for the PLU linked to Membship Price in Membership Types. 


You can check this by running the below stored procedure, making sure there are no NULL fields in the RenewCost column.

[dbo].[MC_RetrieveMembershipSchemes]


If there are NULL's in any of the records, go into the Membship Price PLU, then View/Add Price, make a change and put it back (change date field up a year and then down again), then press Apply. This will then resolve the issue.

title: Potential Scenario Why A Customer Receives The Wrong Booking Confirmation Email Template
text: If a customer receives the wrong booking confirmation email template, the cause could be the below, that you could send to the site to explain what could have caused this. You will need to change all the text highlighted in yellow to personalise to the site. I also want to give you a potential scenario where this behaviour can occur. Say this customer had previous been on the Santa's Grotto booking page. They type in 'Paignton Zoo' on their web browser, which their device auto-fills in the remaining text for the last web page they accessed relating to Paignton Zoo, which is the Santa's Grotto booking page. They then see that is the wrong page they want, so they click on the Paignton Zoo logo to go to your main website, to go onto another one of your booking pages to buy tickets, or membership in this case. Our website records the Santa's Grotto template as the first template the customer accesses to send them the confirmation email template for. This functionality is required for follow-on templates and adding more tickets to the basket on different booking templates. The system always uses the first booking template the customer accessed, as 99% of the time, this is the correct email template to be sent to the customer. But unfortunately, this does account for rare situations this is incorrect. However, trying to implement a fix for this, is likely to break another scenario which is more likely to occur. I hope this makes sense and you understand this behaviour.
description:
If a customer receives the wrong booking confirmation email template, the cause could be the below, that you could send to the site to explain what could have caused this. You will need to change all the text highlighted in yellow to personalise to the site.


I also want to give you a potential scenario where this behaviour can occur. Say this customer had previous been on the Santa's Grotto booking page. They type in 'Paignton Zoo' on their web browser, which their device auto-fills in the remaining text for the last web page they accessed relating to Paignton Zoo, which is the Santa's Grotto booking page.

They then see that is the wrong page they want, so they click on the Paignton Zoo logo to go to your main website, to go onto another one of your booking pages to buy tickets, or membership in this case.

Our website records the Santa's Grotto template as the first template the customer accesses to send them the confirmation email template for. This functionality is required for follow-on templates and adding more tickets to the basket on different booking templates. The system always uses the first booking template the customer accessed, as 99% of the time, this is the correct email template to be sent to the customer. But unfortunately, this does account for rare situations this is incorrect. However, trying to implement a fix for this, is likely to break another scenario which is more likely to occur.

I hope this makes sense and you understand this behaviour.

title: If MeracPDB/PDBUpdater Windows Service Has Been Uninstalled, But Still Showing In Services
text: If you want to uninstall a service, you To uninstall a Windows service, you can use the command prompt and the sc delete command, or the InstallUtil.exe tool. First, you'll need to identify the service's name. Then, open a command prompt with administrator privileges and run the sc delete "ServiceName" command, replacing "ServiceName" with the actual service name. Alternatively, if the service was installed with InstallUtil.exe, you can run command prompt as an administrator, then run this: InstallUtil.exe /uninstall .exe. However, if for some reason this only disables the service in Services and you try performing sc delete "meracpdb" in command prompt and receive "The specified service has been marked for deletion.", then try running the both below, where the service should then disappear: taskkill /F /IM mmc.exe taskkill /F /IM .exe
description:
If you want to uninstall a service, you 

To uninstall a Windows service, you can use the command prompt and the sc delete command, or the InstallUtil.exe tool. First, you'll need to identify the service's name. Then, open a command prompt with administrator privileges and run the sc delete "ServiceName" command, replacing "ServiceName" with the actual service name.


Alternatively, if the service was installed with InstallUtil.exe, you can run command prompt as an administrator, then run this: InstallUtil.exe /uninstall <ServiceName>.exe.


However, if for some reason this only disables the service in Services and you try performing sc delete "meracpdb" in command prompt and receive "The specified service has been marked for deletion.", then try running the both below, where the service should then disappear:

taskkill /F /IM mmc.exe

taskkill /F /IM <ServiceName>.exe

title: "Item cannot be found..." Error Cannot Be Found When Opening Day View In Diary Screen
text: If you click open the Day View for a day on the Diary screen and receive the "Item cannot be found in the collection corresponding to the requested name or ordinal." error following an upgrade. This is likely due to there being an additional column included into the latest stored procedure MC_DiaryDayView. However, the customer might have an ALT stored procedure setup called MC_AltDiaryDayView. You will need to see whether the additional column needs to be added to the ALT or just to rename the ALT, so it does not get referenced going forward. This issue occurred on ticket 75809.
description:

However, the customer might have an ALT stored procedure setup called MC_AltDiaryDayView.



You will need to see whether the additional column needs to be added to the ALT or just to rename the ALT, so it does not get referenced going forward.


This issue occurred on ticket 75809.

title: Average Cost not Calculating
text: In certain MStore installations, the average cost of stock items may not update correctly after receiving goods via a purchase order or updating stock through the Stock Index/Movements. This should only MStore environments running versions earlier than 3.19.14. The stored procedure [MC_UpdateStock] uses the @PODateTime parameter to determine whether the stock cost fields should be updated. In affected versions, if @PODateTime is NULL, a fixed fallback date of '1 Jan 2000' is used. This can cause the DATEDIFF comparison to incorrectly evaluate to a non-positive result, thereby skipping the average cost update. This issue was resolved in version 3.19.14. From this version onwards, the procedure correctly defaults to GETDATE() when @PODateTime is null, ensuring the logic works as expected. Manual Fix (for older versions) To manually apply the fix on affected sites: Locate the following line in [dbo].[MC_UpdateStock]: if (select DATEDIFF(SECOND, isnull(stkLatestCostLastUpdated, '1 Jan 2000'),isnull(@PODateTime, '1 Jan 2000')) Replace it with: if (select DATEDIFF(SECOND, isnull(stkLatestCostLastUpdated, '1 Jan 2000'),isnull(@PODateTime, GETDATE())) Then execute. This fix is NOT retroactive. It will only take place once stock items are next updated or POs are completed.
description:
In certain MStore installations, the average cost of stock items may not update correctly after receiving goods via a purchase order or updating stock through the Stock Index/Movements. This should only MStore environments running versions earlier than 3.19.14.


The stored procedure [MC_UpdateStock] uses the @PODateTime parameter to determine whether the stock cost fields should be updated. In affected versions, if @PODateTime is NULL, a fixed fallback date of '1 Jan 2000' is used. This can cause the DATEDIFF comparison to incorrectly evaluate to a non-positive result, thereby skipping the average cost update.


This issue was resolved in version 3.19.14. From this version onwards, the procedure correctly defaults to GETDATE() when @PODateTime is null, ensuring the logic works as expected.



Manual Fix (for older versions)

To manually apply the fix on affected sites:

Locate the following line in [dbo].[MC_UpdateStock]: 

if (select DATEDIFF(SECOND, isnull(stkLatestCostLastUpdated, '1 Jan 2000'),isnull(@PODateTime, '1 Jan 2000'))

Replace it with: 

if (select DATEDIFF(SECOND, isnull(stkLatestCostLastUpdated, '1 Jan 2000'),isnull(@PODateTime, GETDATE()))

Then execute.


This fix is NOT retroactive. It will only take place once stock items are next updated or POs are completed.

title: Validating Membership Card Online Fails After 30 Seconds
text: If customers report that they are attempting to validate certain membership cards online and are failing, and you can recreate this yourself with the membership card in question, check the web logs and it might state the Execution Timeout Expired, then the server/SQL instance requires more memory. Speak to who maintains the MStore database server to increase the memory for SQL. A ticket example of this is 77749.
